message.content: This question requires knowledge about the properties of candy and how it interacts with different environments. Candy disintegrates in a pool because the water causes it to break down and dissolve. Option (A) is incorrect because sand does not have the same effect on candy as water does. Option (C) is incorrect because a dry bowl does not have any substance or liquid that would cause the candy to disintegrate. Option (D) is also incorrect because the cold temperature of the fridge does not cause candy to disintegrate, it may only affect its texture or hardness.

This question requires some basic understanding of candy's properties and how it interacts with different environments. Candy is made up of sugar and other ingredients that can dissolve in water. When candy is placed in a pool, which is filled with water, it will come into contact with the water and start to dissolve or disintegrate. Option (A) is incorrect because sand does not have the same properties as water and would not cause candy to disintegrate. Option (C) is incorrect because a dry bowl does not contain any liquid that could cause the candy to dissolve. Option (D) is incorrect because the fridge does not contain water or any liquid that would cause candy to disintegrate.
